overview.title: Overview
overview.description: Anxiety Aid Tools is built with privacy as a core principle. We collect minimal data, store everything locally on your device, and use only privacy-focused analytics. No personal information is collected or shared.

noPersonalData.title: No Personal Data
noPersonalData.description: We do not collect, store, or process any personal information such as names, email addresses, phone numbers, or location data.

analytics.title: Analytics
analytics.description: We use Cloudflare Web Analytics, a privacy-focused analytics service that collects only aggregated, anonymized data:
items: No cookies, fingerprinting, or personal tracking

localStorage.title: Local Storage
localStorage.description: Your preferences (such as language selection and dark mode) are stored only on your device using browser local storage. This data never leaves your device.

rights.title: Your Rights
rights.description: Since we don't collect personal data, there is no personal information to access, modify, or delete. You can clear your local preferences at any time through your browser settings.

changes.title: Changes to This Policy
changes.description: We may update this privacy policy occasionally. The date at the top indicates the last revision. Continued use of the app constitutes acceptance of any changes.

medicalDisclaimer.title: Medical Disclaimer
medicalDisclaimer.description: Anxiety Aid Tools provides general anxiety management techniques and educational information. It is NOT a substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment. Always seek the advice of a qualified healthcare provider with any questions regarding a medical or mental health condition. Never disregard professional medical advice or delay seeking it because of something you have learned through this app. If you are experiencing a mental health crisis, please contact emergency services or a crisis hotline immediately.

items.a: For immediate anxiety relief, try the 2-minute breathing exercise. For grounding during panic, use the 5-4-3-2-1 technique.
